request.description:
API to login using mail and password. 

**Successful Login** :

In the event of successful log in. The header of the response will be set to the JWT token.
The response body will have the below key-value: 
- "status":"ok"
- "user": the given token
- "role":"user"

**Unsuccessful Login** :

There are 2 cases of this:
1. Email exists BUT password doesn't match

In this case. The API response body will be:
- "status": "ok"
- "user": "error"
- "role": "error"

2. Email doesn't exist at all

In this case. The API response body will be:
- "status": "error"
- "user": "error"

API to signUp using various attributes.

**The API takes following params from request body:**
- name : Give the name of the user
- rating : this is automatically provided by the API. The default value is 1. **Do not take this value from user**
- email : Validate the email address in the frontend. No validation is done in the backend. Uniqueness of the mail is checked in the backend.
- password: Password is hashed in the backend
- about: A slight description about the user. 

**The API returns :**
- The response of the database it self. If any validation error is seen. Check the requirements of request body.
